author: GeluNumber1
title: Enter the shrine...
review:
When I went to TRU this friday, I was surprised to find this set on the shelf. Certainly, I was happy.

Pros:

great pieces-headpiece, snakes, staff, bricks and armour.

uncommon colors--dark blue, dark sand

cool minifigure

function--snakes fly off the ground with the push of a lever

good piece-to-price ratio

 

Cons:

color scheme is cluttered

boring build

looks uninteresting

gaps in build

 

Overall, it's worth the $6.99 US.

author: legoDad42
title: Year of the SNAKE...and parts!
review:
After a quick trip to ToysRUs I was pleasantly surprised to find a few new NinjaGo sets, with the Venomari Shrine catching my eye with some bitingly beautiful NEW parts.

At 86+ parts for $9.50 (TRU price) the Shrine stands about 3" tall and over 4" wide with a double venomous snake launching trap, new Zane ZX mini-fig., and some nice new parts!

Check it out...

Box/Instruction Art...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5669-1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5668-1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5667.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5677.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5726.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5725-1.jpg[/img]
Note: Love the new weapons checklist! Good for the kids to keep track...and me too...;)

The PARTS...!

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5670-1.jpg[/img]
Note: MANY stand out parts here...printed snake head element, pearl gold Venomari Staff, lime green snakes, 1x1 trans-green printed round tiles, pearl gold shoulder armor/double sword sheath, new cowl with gold adornment for Zane and 1x2 brick element with brick facade in dark tan!

Venomari Shrine...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5678.jpg[/img]

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5692.jpg[/img]
Note: Fangs dripping venomous poison creating a deadly river!
[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5688-1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5687-1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5685-1.jpg[/img]
Note: Source of the venom(?)...the deadly and awesome oozing eyes of the snake!
[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5684-1.jpg[/img]

Playfunction...Double Flying Snake Trap!

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5694-1.jpg[/img]
Note: A simple lever, left and right of the venom river...
[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5719-1.jpg[/img]
Note:...snap down and the deadly venom snakes will launch, protecting the Golden Venomari Staff. Also, for stability, hold down the center of the shrine when snapping the lever and when mounting the snakes, keep 'em loose and not too tight a clutch.

MINI-FIG...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5721-1.jpg[/img][img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5722-1.jpg[/img]
Note: New Zane ZX figure with new cowl, pearl gold shoulder armor/twin blade sheath and pearl gray samurai sword. Torso printing front/back, and front legs only.

Summary...

[img]http://i5.photobucket.com/albums/y174/PencillerZero/DSCN5724-1.jpg[/img]

Another great small set from Lego. You get so much for so little...New Zane ZX figure, fun shrine with lot's of playability and awesome new parts. Not sure where else these new elements with the brick facade will turn up but for MOC'ers out there, pick this up pronto.

Normal retail should be around $6.99 at your local Lego Store (in shop this December coming up).

Highly Recommended...says LegoDad42!
(oh, don't forget to use this shrine/temple with your Indy mini-fig. Should scare the bejeezus outta' him...;)

Edit: I made a small mistake in the build. The two 'dripping' venom/fangs should be of different lengths. I used an extra trans-lime green stud. Only use one of those studs in this part of the build....oopsy...;)

author: Dragon_Master_48
title: What an Amazing Value for Such a Small Set!
review:
9440 Venomari Shrine is the smallest boxed set from the 2012 "Rise of the Snakes" Ninjago sets, the first wave of sets that featured the Serpentine antagonists. Although this set itself does not include any Serpentine minifigures, it does include two smaller snakes. Don't think that either of these factors hurts this set, though! In fact, I would personally argue that it does quite the opposite of expectations: it is among the best sets under $10, and even manages to compete with slightly larger sets- after all, you can buy two of these for the price of one larger set, and get even more spectacular and versatile parts! This set is an amazing value for such a small price!

Aside from including a good variety of colors and pieces that can be used in multiple situations (unlike some of the brightly-colored pieces in the larger sets), this set includes many new parts as well. If you want to build something a little bigger (e.g. A snake palace), you can easily do so with two (or even one, if you're willing to limit your imagination a bit) of these sets. One particular piece that stands out in this set is the 1x2 profile brick that looks like an actual brick. Only getting one or two of these would be incredible, but, no, you get a grand total of six! How can you say no to that?

Even though this set simply looks good, that doesn't mean that there aren't any play features. On each side, there are platforms that can be used to launch the included snakes up in the air; although this feature isn't the greatest of all the Ninjago sets, it's a nice inclusion, and adds a little to the playability.

Pros

  • Venomari Snake Staff.
  • New Snake mold pieces.
  • Launching feature.
  • LEGO bricks that look like real bricks (always handy to have); 6 total included in this set.
  • Amazing detail for 86 pieces.
  • "Snake head" on shrine has printing on it; no stickers!

Cons

  • Only one sword for Zane.
  • No Serpentine minifigure.

Aside from a few minor details, this set is quite a bargain and, if you are interested in buying this, you should not hesitate to do so. Overall, this set can be enjoyed by all ages as both a playset and a little display piece. If you happen to buy more than one, you can use the parts for even greater things... or maybe just build an even awesomer shrine...?

author: AETerry
title: Venomari Shrine Review
review:
While I'm not a huge fan of Ninjago, the new snakes theme and Snakemen of 2012 have caught my attention. This particular set doesn't have any of the new snakemen, but it does have Zane and several other good little pieces like the new cobra snakes.

I'd say at $6.99 and with 86 pieces, the price is well worth it. Especially with all the new pieces found in this set. There are 1x2 bricks with ridging on them that make for great adobe style look and feel. The new snake pieces themselves, the gold staff and Zane himself.

Zane comes with a gold shoulder pad piece that he can hold up to two katanas in back. His hood is different from the older ninja hoods with a clip on the back for holding a sword. Looks wise he is great.

The Shrine Build is a solid set and looks great with the snake feel and venomous neon green elements on it. I'm still not a fan of the flick style weapons and deals. There's two "flips" that can be hit down to launch the snakes into the air at Zane. I'm sure younger kids will find great appeal in that aspect. For me as an adult, it's a gimmick that doesn't work or appeal.

All in all it's a great set and well worth it to Ninjago collectors and fans or those looking parts and pieces for MOCing purposes.

author: a42
title: Hidden mountain shrine of epicness!
review:
Picked this up cheap. Well worth it.

Pros

  • Snakes jump out at Zane very well!
  • Zane looks PERFECT for the shrine
  • River of mountain dew?
  • Zane has double sword holder.

Cons

  • A bit of rockery would not go undesired.

Epic set, though small, it is cheap. Buy it.

author: daninu12345
title: This is a great set for an extremely good amount of money.
review:
When I first saw the pictures for this set I  thought LEGO would overprice it (like usual) and make it about $15,but when I had seen the price I liked it a lot. This is one of the best LEGO Ninjago sets lego made under $20 this year. I love the playability, this model is stronger than you would think I dropped it and only the new style lego snakes and the staff fell off. Please note that those are only the loose pieces. Over all this is a great set and if I had designed this set i would sneak in Spitta and raise the price to $10.

I hope everyone like this great Ninjago set!!

author: xccj
title: Nice Little Ninjago Set
review:
This is the cheapest brick-built set for Ninjago this year, and is clearly intended to be an impulse purchase.  So how good is it?

 

First off, I want to note that the instruction booklet is HUGE for a set this size.  I think it has to be this size to accommodate the list of weapons that appears in the center, but really it just seems excessive.

 

There's only one minifigure here: Zane ZK.  He's pretty cool in his updated White Ninja armor, and the new gold shoulder armor / back sword holder is awesome too.  Unfortunately, the set does only come with one katana, so Zane can't fully equip his backpack.

 

As for pieces, this set has a bunch in dark tan and lime green, with a few other dark shades thrown in.  Of note are the new snake pieces (which have handles on their tails, so they can double as weapons) and the gold Venomari snake staff, which is a neat design but comes in most of the other Ninjago sets too.  Also of particular interest are the 6 brick-brick pieces.  Basically, there's standard 1x2 bricks with a brick pattern molded into one of the sides.  It's nice to see six of these new, cool elements in a cheaper set, although I'm sure MOCers could use a ton more.

 

The actual construction of the shrine isn't that complex.  The coolest build feature is the upside-down antennas forming fangs out of the printed-wedge / snake head.  There are also little levers used for flicking the green snakes out at Zane.  The function, while simple, does a decent job at launching the snakes out.  It's a shame that there aren't any other foes for Zane to fight, but I guess snakes getting launched at you must be scary enough.

 

Overall, this is a nice little impulse set that can introduce you to this years Ninjago theme.  It comes with 86 bricks for only $6.99 USD, so that is a good value.  In addition to that, the brick-bricks and Zane minifigure add value to the set.  It may not be as good as some of the larger vehicles, but it does a good job of showing the Ninja vs Snake conflict.

author: Mr_Malfoy
title: "The posion spit of the Venomari makes your worst nightmares real..."
review:
I LOVE this set! It's a great way to stack up on "brick-bricks". I will be reviewing this set in four sections: Minifigures, The Shrine, Playability, and Value.

 

Minifigures:

1. Zane ZX: The only minifigure in this set. His upgraded suit, armor, and headwrap are far better than the original Zane. He comes with a silver katana. It would've been nice if he came with two katanas.

 

The Shrine: Beautiful and awesome all rolled into one. The dripping venom is a nice touch, especially since they make it look like the venom is coming from the snake head carving.

 

Playability: The two Venomari vipers can flung by pressing down on the two black levers. They can actually go quite far.

 

Value: For $6.99, this is definitely a great deal.

 

Minifigures: 10 / 10

 

The Shrine: 10 / 10

 

Playability: 10 / 10

 

Value: 10 / 10

 

Buy this set!

author: StynaMN
title: 9440 Venomari Shrine - Great Little Set!
review:
This late 2011/early 2012 Ninjago release is a simple yet fun set. It's good way to start out your 'Rise of the Snakes' collection, because of it's size and price. 

  The price of $6.99 is great, considering the fact that some minifigures sell for the same price. 8 cents per piece is not bad at all.

Let's look at the details -

Box/Instructions

  The box is just a small one, the front printed with a picture of the set, and the back, as usual, describing in pictures what some of the features are.

  Instructions are simple and easy-to-follow, and the booklet is small. Easy for toddlers to understand.

Parts

  The parts are good for a set this small, actually. It comes with some of the new Masonry-Profile Bricks, which are really great new pieces. Two lime-colored vipers are included, along with a piece with a viper printed on stone.

  There are many transparent pieces in the set as well. Finally, the Venomari staff is exclusive to this set, which is another reason to buy it.

Minifigures

  Zane ZX - The only minifig in the set. He is mainly white, with some clothing and weapon detail. He is wearing a gold shoulder pad piece, and also a has an star-shaped accent on his wrap in the same gold. He has a yellow, straight face, not double-sided.

The build

  The build is simple, takes about 5-10 minutes. The only part that could spell a bit of trouble for toddlers is the black launchers, which sometimes don't go down exactly the way you want.

The completed model

  The completed model is fun to have, and has some good detail. The launcher is fun also, if you really slam it, you can send those vipers into Ninjago Series 3!

Summary

  Overall, this is a great set. It's cheap, and includes some great pieces. I highly recommend this set to start off your collection, or to just continue it!


Until next time, 

  ~LegoRokz112

author: tomasubrick
title: Snakes!
review:
I bought this at Lego land for £5.99 and is my first Ninjago set.

Box/Instructions

The box art shows a snake jumping from the shrine and attacking Zane, and Zane blocking the snake with his sword. The Picture is the actual product, with special effects and a background put in. The age range for the product is 7-12.

The Instructions are very easy to follow and includes a check-list of the
exclusive accessories half way through.

Parts

The sets main parts include a stone that looks like a snakes head with 2 lime green sticks coming down from it to represent a snake dripping venom, and underneath clear lime green bricks to represent the venom that was dripping down, some leaves , 2 lime green snakes and of course the viper staff that is exclusive to the set.

Minifigures

Only one minifigure is included in the set which is;

*Zane ZX

A detailed ZX version of Zane, the ice ninja.

Head Piece 

A white nina headpiece with a golden shape on it that looks like an upside down T

Head

The yellow head shows an angry expression, but with the headpiece on, you can only see the eyes

Neckpiece

The neck piece adds two golden shoulder armour for Zane, and a circular sword holder, to obviously hold his sword, which is very hard to get in unfortunately.

Torso

The torso is quite nice, it is white with yellow lines representing a sort of ninja gi, and rope across to look like the sword holders straps and a brown belt. Most of the torso is connected to the legs to make it look like a robe

Legs

The legs look like rest of the torso robe.

Accessories

A simple dark grey sword.


The build

The build took around 10 mins with no tedious building, no tricky pieces (except the sword on Zane, buts that's the minifigure)

The completed model

The completed model looks very good and even better with other Ninjago sets. The shrine looks like a snake dripping venom and the floor with flowing venom and 2 snakes side by side that fling to stop Zane from getting the serpent staff

Summary

This is a good set, but only if you have other Ninjago sets to go with it, and attack it to an extra part of a set to do with snakes. As the only playability of it is for Zane to dodge 2 snakes and tiptoe round the venom and get the staff. If you have no other snake related Ninjago sets, it is better for display than play.

author: Lego_fan_
title: a neat little starter set.
review: This neat little set is a good set for those who like Ninjago or who need a set to set them up with it. It is a fun little build with a good selection of parts if you want to build your own thing and includes two baby venomari, plus a Zane minifigure. you get a good guy and two bad guys which is great for those who are starting off with Ninjago or need for characters. the build itself is a mini section from the city of orabourus and has the venomari staff. you can have zane try to get it but you can clip the snakes to the build and shoot them off with the function. I highly recomend this set to any Ninjago fan or Lego fan in general.

author: InkPrincess
title: Zane needs his shurikens
review:
I ordered my set off of eBay after Amazon tried to sell me it for $50. It was out of box, so I dont have any room to comment on that.

The instructions were fairly easy to follow. I'm missing two 1x1 black bricks, but the structure holds just as it would with them. I intend to order them later on, mostly to ease the OCD it gives me.

I'm a sucker for any Ninjago set that has Zane in it, so it was an almost instant buy for me. This would be the first time I've ever ordered something preowned without a box. But the seller was very nice and it arrived into the mail early, so I didnt feel very anxious. Zane's paint job on his figure looks just like it would in the series, and I was very happy about that. I'm still a bit impartial about him having a sword instead of the famed Shurikens.

The dripping venom pieces took a bit of time for me to ignore, since I got a bit paranoid that a neon green clear stud was missing, until I realized it was supposed to be uneven.

The snakes pop up like they're supposed to. I almost lost one when I was testing it out, so I wouldn't play with the set on a surface that's hard to move from against a wall.

I honestly kind of wish that it came with a Serpentine general of some kind, mostly to make the staff's presence more fitting and make more of a nod towards Season 1. But all in all, I enjoy playing with this set most when I combine it with my other sets to add to my massive personal Lego world.
